Adjusting the refresh rate on your monitor is a great way to reduce eye strain, especially if you spend a lot of time on your computer. Most monitors have a default refresh rate of 60 Hz, but you can adjust it to 75 Hz or higher for a smoother viewing experience. To change your monitor's refresh rate:

1. Right-click on your desktop and select "Display settings" on Windows or "System Preferences > Displays" on a Mac. 2. Select the "Advanced display settings" or "Display preferences" option. 3. Click on the "Monitor" tab, and choose a higher refresh rate from the drop-down menu. 4. Click "Apply" to save the changes. Keep in mind that not all monitors can handle higher refresh rates, so make sure to check your monitor's user manual or manufacturer's website for compatibility before making any changes.
